title: Best practices
description: Business capability modeling is a technique for the representation of an organization’s business anchor model, independent of the organization’s structure, processes, people, or domains.

paragraphs.title: Don’t overlap
paragraphs.description: Good capabilities do not overlap; they are mutually exclusive. A good test is to check whether you can assign Level 2 capabilities without ambiguity.

paragraphs.title: Define “What”; not “How”
paragraphs.description: Business capabilities encapsulate what a business is doing right now and what it must be doing to meet current and future challenges.

paragraphs.title: Long-term stability
paragraphs.description: Properly defined business capabilities are fairly stable over time, persisting throughout any organizational changes. Only major model updates should affect them.

paragraphs.title: Cross-organizational
paragraphs.description: Don’t focus too much on business units. Capabilities should remain the same and be independent of the current structure of the organization.

paragraphs.title: 7 to 10 capabilities at the top level
paragraphs.description: The highest level capabilities should be a complete description of your business. Aim to make your categories reflect key aspects of what the business actually does.

paragraphs.title: Breadth rather than depth
paragraphs.description: Don’t go too deep. Illustrate the breadth of your organization’s business capabilities by going no more than three levels down. This will be enough to represent IT landscape of your enterprise.

paragraphs.title: Accepted by all stakeholders
paragraphs.description: The goal of business capabilities is that they become a common basis for discussion and planning. Take every opportunity to anchor your organization's processes to the model.

paragraphs.title: Linking strategy and execution
paragraphs.description: Involve those who define the strategies when creating your map. Consider strategy as one input when defining your business capabilities on the highest level.
